title: Furry friends: Lilo the Lhasa Apso gently strokes hamster Coopoo
text:
For most rodents, being bared down upon by the imposing figure of a dog ten times their size would spook them into scurrying away.

But for hamster Coopoo, it is a perfectly normal show of affection from his floppy-eared friend Lilo.

Lilo, a Lhasa Apso, and Coopoo have forged an unlikely bond since they began living together in Lucy Darabi's home in Conisbrough, South Yorkshire.

Pooch Lilo strokes hamster Coopoo's fur as the rodent sniffs the leather sofa, utterly unfazed by the contact of the much larger pooch at their shared home in South Yorkshire

Ms Darabi adopted Lilo last April and said that the two pets have been friends ever since.

Her short clip posted to Twitter, captioned 'My dog and hamster are BFFLs [best friends for life]', showcases the animals' friendship.

In the video, the pair of pets are seen adorably cosying up to each other on the sofa.

It shows the fluffy black pooch lying beside the brown and white hamster which is sniffing the brown leather surface.

Lilo then stretches out a furry paw and gently strokes Coopoo, who remains totally unfazed by the contact from the much bigger animal.

Lucy Darabi, from Conisbrough, South Yorkshire, adopted Lilo the Lhasa Apso last April and the pooch immediately became friends with her hamster Coopoo

The black floppy-eared dog continues to brush Coopoo's fur as the hamster plods along the surface of the sofa, before falling down the side of the seat cushion and into the gap (right)

The canine continues to brush the hamster and watches as he plods along the couch.

Lilo also presses her nose up to Coopoo's side and and even briefly licks his fur.

As Coopoo moves closer to the edge of the seat cushion, it slowly slides down into the gap at the middle of the sofa, prompting a short snort of amusement from Ms Darabi, who is filming.

The footage has been viewed over 1,000 times and 'liked' by almost one hundred people.
description: Lilo, the Lhasa Apso, and Coopoo the hamster have forged an unlikely bond since they began living together in Lucy Darabi's home in Conisbrough, South Yorkshire.
